Title: Indonesian Higher Education Learning Strategy Facing Industry 4.0: Program for Implementing the SPOCs Learning Model
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sudirwan, J., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pelawi, D., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper aims to propose learning strategy in Indonesian Higher Education Institutions toward Education 4.0, This literature review study focuses on the selection of learning strategy with the MOOC models. The choice of strategy was based on the analysis of current issues of MOOCs implementation as opposed to the provision of Human Resource competencies facing Industry 4.0. Those strengths and weaknesses faced with opportunities for applying the MOOCs models that were compatible with the Higher Education environment operation, such as geographical and economic of the community. The result was SPOCs learning model as one model, which can meet current learning needs that are effective, flexible, accountable, and could be run within selected class whether face-to-face, online, blended or flipped class. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Facings; Industry 4.0; Information management; Personnel; blended; Higher education; Higher education institutions; Human resource competencies; Learning models; Learning strategy; Literature reviews; SPOCs; Learning systems

Title: The maturity of quality management implementation at higher education institutions of informatics study in Indonesia, as perceived by the lecturers
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sudirwan, J., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research was aimed to determine the most factors that have influenced the progress of implementation of quality management in higher education institutions, especially Informatics study. The approach used in this research was a quantitative research, using survey method and regression analysis technique. Its population was the lecturer of Higher Education Institutions of Informatics in Indonesia and 271 lecturers were taken as sample and selected using stratified random sampling. The results of data analysis show that quality management system implemented by the institutions was very good as 4.15 from 5 scales. The most influenced factors were organizational culture and lecturers caring, and there no significant differences between State Higher Educations and the private. Therefore, to increase the organizational capability of Higher Education Institutions, especially informatics study, to produce higher quality graduates, must be improved the maturity of quality management systems and its factors influenced such as organizational culture and lecturers caring, and professionalism simultaneously. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: lecturer's caring; organizational culture; professionalism and organizational capability; Quality management
Index Keywords: Information management; Quality control; Regression analysis; Higher education; Higher education institutions; lecturer's caring; Organizational capabilities; Organizational cultures; Quality management systems; Quantitative research; Stratified random sampling; Quality management

Title: Academic competence of Computer Science graduate degree from the employer's perspective
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: Information System, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan Anggrek, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suhartono, J., Information System, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan Anggrek, 11530, Indonesia; Sudirwan, J., Information System, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jalan Anggrek, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: This descriptive study aims to determine what competencies are most needed by employers of undergraduate alumne fields of study in Computer Science to meet the needs of the profession. The method used in this research is descriptive method, with a collection of data that originates on the ads required employers, then analysis for the purposes of presenting the data in various categories. The results obtained are maps of professions and competencies most needed employers. By knowing the required professional competence and employers, students can prepare themselves to develop competence and professionalism that is being developed in realizing the ideals and hopes. Likewise, for educational institutions Computer Science can adapt the curriculum to meet the needs of employers, significantly. © 2016 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Computer science; Information management; Competence; Descriptive studies; Educational institutions; employers; Professional; Professional competence; Science graduates; Education
